messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:31): don't forget to fill out http://www.w3.org/2002/09/wbs/35125/TPAC2007/registrants#html if you're going to the f2f btw
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (23:49): that's right, I need to register
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (23:53): can't access that page
ab0b98ba572e65b11a43c4576f0b745b (00:09): What is the channel about?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (00:09): ab0b98ba572e65b11a43c4576f0b745b: http://www.w3.org/html/wg/
ab0b98ba572e65b11a43c4576f0b745b (00:17): Thank you zcorpan
ab0b98ba572e65b11a43c4576f0b745b (00:18): Does Tim Berners Lee chat here?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (00:18): not very often
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (00:19): i think i've seen him here once during a telecon
ab0b98ba572e65b11a43c4576f0b745b (00:19): Are you the people who decide how HTML and related mark ups are going to work and how web browsers should handle it?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (00:20): sort of
ab0b98ba572e65b11a43c4576f0b745b (00:20): That's really something. I'm really impressed.
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (00:21): you can take part
ab0b98ba572e65b11a43c4576f0b745b (00:21): No Im afraid I don't have the knowledge base.
ab0b98ba572e65b11a43c4576f0b745b (00:21): Perhaps some day.
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (00:22): http://ln.hixie.ch/?start=1173385976&count=1
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (00:22): or you can join the whatwg (simpler)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (00:22): http://www.whatwg.org/
ab0b98ba572e65b11a43c4576f0b745b (00:29): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 could you say, in layman's terms, broadly speaking, what kind of work the working group does?

73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (00:33): we work on the html5 spec. which includes researching web pages, existing implementations, writing the spec, implementing the spec, providing implementation feedback, writing test cases
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (00:33): adding new features to html to make things simpler for authors and the experience better for users
ab0b98ba572e65b11a43c4576f0b745b (00:34): I thought html was being abandoned for xhmtl.
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (00:34): it's not
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (00:35): both are worked on in parallell
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (00:35): or actually it's the same language, just different syntax
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:53): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef, does the forms TF have a chair or something?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:54): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef, I'm asking as it's unclear to me how this group is going to start
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:54): as far as i can tell the six members are expected to get their act together on their own
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:54): self-appointing a chair, or working as a group, as desired
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:55): no chair. as hixie says, we're hoping they'll self-organize
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:55): picking your own chair would be fine, I guess
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:56): i'm kinda surprised that the group basically died without even one flamewar
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:56): i'm assuming it'll pick up at some point
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:56): I saw some introductions. that looked like a good start
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:56): yeah it started well
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:56): then fizzled
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:56): yeah, 5 of 6
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:57): there were some mailing list mechanical issues; Chris couldn't send his answer to gregory's question to the list cuz the list got closed
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:57): ah
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:57): in the hand-over to lachy, I accidently got one of the systems guys to close it to non-tf-members
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:58): I said something like "but the system won't prevent posting from people outside the tf" and gerald said "I can fix that... presto."
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:59): I was so impressed that I didn't realized that wasn't what I wanted
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:59): (then there's also the problem that the charters suggest various things that we've to do)
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:00): the initial experiment is to ask the TF to craft a charter out of the various extant bits.
